columns.text: In this problem, we need to solve for the degree of operating leverage in two scenarios. This problem will show how the change in quantity will affect the operating cashflow.

For the first case, the percentage change in operating cashflow is $0.186$ and the percentage change in quantity is $0.057$. Substituting these values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{DO}&=\dfrac{0.186}{0.057}\\[15 pt]
&=3.26
\end{aligned}$$

The degree of operating leverage in this case is $3.26$

For the second case, the percentage change in operating cashflow is $-0.186$ and the percentage change in quantity is given as $-0.057$. The DOL will now be:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{DOL}&=\dfrac{-0.186}{-0.057}\\[15 pt]
&=3.26
\end{aligned}$$

The degree of operating leverage in this case is also $3.26$

As we can see, the DOL in both cases are the same since the percentage change in quantity and cashflow and quantity are also the same with the only difference being the first had positive changes while the second had negative changes.
